20101223030105.000|20101223030108.000|TR0|some pretty tough questions about how 
20101223030108.000|20101223030110.000|TR0|clued-in he really is to possible 
20101223030110.000|20101223030112.000|TR0|terrorist threats.  Clapper's job is to 
20101223030112.000|20101223030114.000|TR0|coordinate what the nation knows about 
20101223030114.000|20101223030116.000|TR0|terrorism and national security.  He's

20101223030118.000|20101223030120.000|TR0|the intelligence community and to make 
20101223030120.000|20101223030122.000|TR0|sure everyone else knows as well.  He's

20101223030705.000|20101223030708.000|TR0|didn't appear to have a homeland nexus and

20101223030710.000|20101223030712.000|TR0|required."

20101223030722.000|20101223030724.000|TR0|posed no risk to Americans?       Well: 
20101223030724.000|20101223030726.000|TR0|"Nevertheless, he should have been briefed 
20101223030726.000|20101223030729.000|TR0|on the arrest, and steps should have been 
20101223030729.000|20101223030731.000|TR0|taken to ensure that he is in the future. 
20101223030731.000|20101223030733.000|TR0|The intelligence community as a whole was

20101223030735.000|20101223030737.000|TR0|tracking it closely."
20101223030737.000|20101223030739.000|TR0|

20101223030741.000|20101223030743.000|TR0|Clapper in the ABC interview, basically

20101223030748.000|20101223030750.000|TR0|below Clapper's rank were following the

20101223030804.000|20101223030806.000|TR0|his staff on those arrests?  Yes.  And I 
20101223030806.000|20101223030809.000|TR0|know there was breathless attention by the 
20101223030809.000|20101223030811.000|TR0|media about these arrests and it was

20101223030813.000|20101223030815.000|TR0|

20101223030817.000|20101223030819.000|TR0|in front of the TV 24 hours a day and 
20101223030819.000|20101223030821.000|TR0|monitoring what's coming out of the media.

20101223030828.000|20101223030830.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Well, you know, we kind of agree 
20101223030830.000|20101223030832.000|TR0|with you on that, Mr. Brennan.  I mean, we 
20101223030832.000|20101223030834.000|TR0|don't want Mr. Clapper to be getting his 
20101223030834.000|20101223030836.000|TR0|briefings from us in the media either.
20101223030836.000|20101223030838.000|TR0|
20101223030838.000|20101223030840.000|TR0|I mean, we think he should be well aware 
20101223030840.000|20101223030842.000|TR0|of any terror threats or suspected plots 
20101223030842.000|20101223030844.000|TR0|or planned arrests or anything, for that 
20101223030844.000|20101223030846.000|TR0|matter, long before we in the media are 
20101223030846.000|20101223030849.000|TR0|reporting the story.  After all, the job 
20101223030849.000|20101223030851.000|TR0|Clapper now holds, director of national 
20101223030851.000|20101223030853.000|TR0|security, was created in 2004 to prevent 
20101223030853.000|20101223030855.000|TR0|the kind of intelligence failures that 
20101223030855.000|20101223030857.000|TR0|allowed the 9/11 attacks to happen in the 
20101223030857.000|20101223030859.000|TR0|first place.
20101223030859.000|20101223030901.000|TR0|
20101223030901.000|20101223030903.000|TR0|In other words, Clapper is to make sure 
20101223030903.000|20101223030905.000|TR0|all the dots are connected.
20101223030905.000|20101223030908.000|TR0|
20101223030908.000|20101223030910.000|TR0|Joining me now to help us connect the dots 
20101223030910.000|20101223030912.000|TR0|is senior political analyst David Gergen 
20101223030912.000|20101223030914.000|TR0|and former CIA Director James Woolsey.
20101223030914.000|20101223030916.000|TR0|
20101223030916.000|20101223030918.000|TR0|Thanks to you both for joining us.
20101223030918.000|20101223030920.000|TR0|
20101223030920.000|20101223030922.000|TR0|JAMES WOOLSEY, FORMER CIA DIRECTOR:  Good 
20101223030922.000|20101223030924.000|TR0|to be with you.
20101223030924.000|20101223030926.000|TR0|

20101223030929.000|20101223030931.000|TR0|you.

20101223031853.000|20101223031855.000|TR0|GERGEN:  Thank you.
20101223031855.000|20101223031857.000|TR0|
20101223031857.000|20101223031859.000|TR0|WOOLSEY:  Same to you.
20101223031859.000|20101223031901.000|TR0|
20101223031901.000|20101223031903.000|TR0|GUPTA:  You can join the live chat now as 
20101223031903.000|20101223031905.000|TR0|well under way at AC360.com.
20101223031905.000|20101223031908.000|TR0|
20101223031908.000|20101223031910.000|TR0|Up next, we're still going to keep them 
20101223031910.000|20101223031912.000|TR0|honest, updates on a couple of stories 
20101223031912.000|20101223031914.000|TR0|about bullying, a topic we have been 
20101223031914.000|20101223031916.000|TR0|following quite closely here on 360.  In 
20101223031916.000|20101223031918.000|TR0|one case, the mother of a California teen 
20101223031918.000|20101223031920.000|TR0|who took his own life is finally getting 
20101223031920.000|20101223031922.000|TR0|attention from the federal government.  We 
20101223031922.000|20101223031924.000|TR0|will see why.
20101223031924.000|20101223031926.000|TR0|
20101223031926.000|20101223031929.000|TR0|Also tonight, it's called faith healing.  
20101223031929.000|20101223031931.000|TR0|We're going to meet two people who say 
20101223031931.000|20101223031933.000|TR0|they have seen it work firsthand.  And we 
20101223031933.000|20101223031935.000|TR0|will talk about whether a man named John 
20101223031935.000|20101223031937.000|TR0|of God has the power to cure what modern 
20101223031937.000|20101223031939.000|TR0|medicine cannot.
20101223031939.000|20101223031941.000|TR0|
20101223031941.000|20101223031943.000|TR0|(COMMERCIAL BREAK)
20101223031943.000|20101223031945.000|TR0|
20101223031945.000|20101223031948.000|TR0|GUPTA:  We have "Keeping Them Honest" 
20101223031948.000|20101223031950.000|TR0|updates now on a couple of stories 
20101223031950.000|20101223031952.000|TR0|tonight: teens who were bullied by others 
20101223031952.000|20101223031954.000|TR0|at school and online.
20101223031954.000|20101223031956.000|TR0|
20101223031956.000|20101223031958.000|TR0|It's an ongoing problem that we have been 
20101223031958.000|20101223032000.000|TR0|following closely for a long time here on 
20101223032000.000|20101223032002.000|TR0|360.  And in many cases, the bullying has 
20101223032002.000|20101223032004.000|TR0|been made worse for the victims due the 
20101223032004.000|20101223032006.000|TR0|prevalence of cell phones and easy access 
20101223032006.000|20101223032009.000|TR0|to the Internet.
20101223032009.000|20101223032011.000|TR0|
20101223032011.000|20101223032013.000|TR0|Tonight, there are developments in two 
20101223032013.000|20101223032015.000|TR0|cases we have paid a lot of attention to, 
20101223032015.000|20101223032017.000|TR0|both involving gay teens.
20101223032017.000|20101223032019.000|TR0|
20101223032019.000|20101223032021.000|TR0|First, the case of 13-year-old Seth Walsh, 
20101223032021.000|20101223032023.000|TR0|an openly gay student from California who 
20101223032023.000|20101223032025.000|TR0|hanged himself in September because he 
20101223032025.000|20101223032028.000|TR0|could no longer take the verbal and 
20101223032028.000|20101223032030.000|TR0|physical abuse from other teens.       
20101223032030.000|20101223032032.000|TR0|Well, now the United States Department of 
20101223032032.000|20101223032034.000|TR0|Education's Office of Civil Rights has 
20101223032034.000|20101223032036.000|TR0|opened an investigation into his case.  
20101223032036.000|20101223032038.000|TR0|Seth has been teased since the fifth 
20101223032038.000|20101223032040.000|TR0|grade, and the abuse only got worse when 
20101223032040.000|20101223032042.000|TR0|he announced he was gay in the sixth grade.
20101223032042.000|20101223032044.000|TR0|
20101223032044.000|20101223032046.000|TR0|His mother, Wendy, says she informed 
20101223032046.000|20101223032049.000|TR0|school officials of the attacks against 
20101223032049.000|20101223032051.000|TR0|Seth, but says they didn't seem to care.  
20101223032051.000|20101223032053.000|TR0|She homeschooled him for a while in the 
20101223032053.000|20101223032055.000|TR0|seventh grade, but Seth eventually 
20101223032055.000|20101223032057.000|TR0|returned to school.
20101223032057.000|20101223032059.000|TR0|
20101223032059.000|20101223032101.000|TR0|After being harassed by a group of teens 
20101223032101.000|20101223032103.000|TR0|in a local park three months ago, Seth 
20101223032103.000|20101223032105.000|TR0|killed himself.
20101223032105.000|20101223032108.000|TR0|
20101223032108.000|20101223032110.000|TR0|Now, Wendy Walsh contacted the ACLU for 
20101223032110.000|20101223032112.000|TR0|assistance, and together they posted a 
20101223032112.000|20101223032114.000|TR0|video of Wendy on YouTube reading Seth's 
20101223032114.000|20101223032116.000|TR0|suicide note.
20101223032116.000|20101223032118.000|TR0|
20101223032118.000|20101223032120.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101223032120.000|20101223032122.000|TR0|
20101223032122.000|20101223032124.000|TR0|WENDY WALSH, MOTHER OF TEEN WHO COMMITTED 
20101223032124.000|20101223032126.000|TR0|SUICIDE:  "Mom, Amanda, Shane, Shawn, I 
20101223032126.000|20101223032129.000|TR0|love you.  Thank you for having me.  It's 
20101223032129.000|20101223032131.000|TR0|been a pleasure.  I know this will bring 
20101223032131.000|20101223032133.000|TR0|you much pain, but I will hopefully be in

20101223032158.000|20101223032200.000|TR0|
20101223032200.000|20101223032202.000|TR0|GUPTA:  It is hard to hear, obviously, 
20101223032202.000|20101223032204.000|TR0|Wendy, Seth's mother there.
20101223032204.000|20101223032206.000|TR0|
20101223032206.000|20101223032209.000|TR0|The ACLU sent a letter to the Tehachapi 
20101223032209.000|20101223032211.000|TR0|School District superintendent, stating 
20101223032211.000|20101223032213.000|TR0|it's their understanding that -- quote -- 
20101223032213.000|20101223032215.000|TR0|"despite being notified of the harassment 
20101223032215.000|20101223032217.000|TR0|and despite the clear obligations under 
20101223032217.000|20101223032219.000|TR0|state and federal law to protect students 
20101223032219.000|20101223032221.000|TR0|from such harassment, neither the school 
20101223032221.000|20101223032223.000|TR0|nor the district took adequate measures to 
20101223032223.000|20101223032225.000|TR0|protect Seth."
20101223032225.000|20101223032228.000|TR0|

20101223032230.000|20101223032232.000|TR0|Seth died, little has been done in his 
20101223032232.000|20101223032234.000|TR0|school or the district to address an 
20101223032234.000|20101223032236.000|TR0|environment of what they call hostility.  
20101223032236.000|20101223032238.000|TR0|The ACLU offered a list of actions the 
20101223032238.000|20101223032240.000|TR0|district could take.
20101223032240.000|20101223032242.000|TR0|

20101223032244.000|20101223032246.000|TR0|and the president of the school board for 
20101223032246.000|20101223032249.000|TR0|reaction, but were unsuccessful.
20101223032249.000|20101223032251.000|TR0|
20101223032251.000|20101223032253.000|TR0|And there's a development as well in 
20101223032253.000|20101223032255.000|TR0|another story we have followed closely, 
20101223032255.000|20101223032257.000|TR0|the case of Tyler Clementi.  He also 
20101223032257.000|20101223032259.000|TR0|committed suicide in September.  His 
20101223032259.000|20101223032301.000|TR0|parents have put Rutgers University on 
20101223032301.000|20101223032303.000|TR0|notice that they may file a lawsuit for 
20101223032303.000|20101223032305.000|TR0|failing to protect their son.
20101223032305.000|20101223032308.000|TR0|
20101223032308.000|20101223032310.000|TR0|Tyler was an 18-year-old Rutgers student 
20101223032310.000|20101223032312.000|TR0|who took his own life after two other 
20101223032312.000|20101223032314.000|TR0|students, including his roommate, 
20101223032314.000|20101223032316.000|TR0|allegedly used a Web camera to record a 
20101223032316.000|20101223032318.000|TR0|sexual encounter Tyler had with another 
20101223032318.000|20101223032320.000|TR0|man.  They then streamed it online.  
20101223032320.000|20101223032322.000|TR0|Rutgers says it's not responsible for 
20101223032322.000|20101223032324.000|TR0|Tyler's suicide.
20101223032324.000|20101223032326.000|TR0|
20101223032326.000|20101223032329.000|TR0|We will continue to follow these stories 
20101223032329.000|20101223032331.000|TR0|as they develop.
20101223032331.000|20101223032333.000|TR0|
20101223032333.000|20101223032335.000|TR0|But -- but it's not just teens who harass 
20101223032335.000|20101223032337.000|TR0|gay students. Incredibly, back in October, 
20101223032337.000|20101223032339.000|TR0|a man named Clint McCance, the vice 
20101223032339.000|20101223032341.000|TR0|president of the Midland School District 
20101223032341.000|20101223032343.000|TR0|in Arkansas, posted a series of anti-gay 
20101223032343.000|20101223032345.000|TR0|remarks on his Facebook page.  He said he 
20101223032345.000|20101223032348.000|TR0|likes that gay people give each other AIDS 
20101223032348.000|20101223032350.000|TR0|and die, and that he would disown his own 
20101223032350.000|20101223032352.000|TR0|kids if they were gay.
20101223032352.000|20101223032354.000|TR0|
20101223032354.000|20101223032356.000|TR0|He also said, "Seriously, they want me to 
20101223032356.000|20101223032358.000|TR0|wear purple because five queers committed 
20101223032358.000|20101223032400.000|TR0|suicide?"  That's a direct quote.  "The 
20101223032400.000|20101223032402.000|TR0|only way I'm wearing it for them is if 
20101223032402.000|20101223032404.000|TR0|they all commit suicide," he wrote.  I 
20101223032404.000|20101223032406.000|TR0|can't believe the people of this world 
20101223032406.000|20101223032409.000|TR0|have gotten this stupid."
20101223032409.000|20101223032411.000|TR0|
20101223032411.000|20101223032413.000|TR0|Two of the five people he was referring 
20101223032413.000|20101223032415.000|TR0|to, Seth Walsh and Tyler Clementi.
20101223032415.000|20101223032417.000|TR0|
20101223032417.000|20101223032419.000|TR0|Now, when McCance's remarks were made 
20101223032419.000|20101223032421.000|TR0|public, people across the country 
20101223032421.000|20101223032423.000|TR0|expressed their anger, expressed their 
20101223032423.000|20101223032425.000|TR0|outrage at him, and their immediate calls 
20101223032425.000|20101223032428.000|TR0|for his resignation.
20101223032428.000|20101223032430.000|TR0|
20101223032430.000|20101223032432.000|TR0|We at 360 wanted answers as well to find 
20101223032432.000|20101223032434.000|TR0|out if he stood by his remarks.
20101223032434.000|20101223032436.000|TR0|
20101223032436.000|20101223032438.000|TR0|"Keeping Them Honest," Anderson confronted 
20101223032438.000|20101223032440.000|TR0|Clint McCance, and he got some action.
20101223032440.000|20101223032442.000|TR0|

20101223032444.000|20101223032446.000|TR0|

20101223032449.000|20101223032451.000|TR0|you have written some really terrible 
20101223032451.000|20101223032453.000|TR0|things.  You called kids who killed 
20101223032453.000|20101223032455.000|TR0|themselves because of bullying fags and 
20101223032455.000|20101223032457.000|TR0|queers.  You wrote that you like to see 
20101223032457.000|20101223032459.000|TR0|gay people die.

20101223032503.000|20101223032505.000|TR0|people that much, that you like to see

20101223032526.000|20101223032529.000|TR0|posted that on down further in -- in my

20101223032754.000|20101223032756.000|TR0|hate-monger or I'm a horrible person.  And 
20101223032756.000|20101223032758.000|TR0|that's -- that's not me at all.
20101223032758.000|20101223032800.000|TR0|

20101223032802.000|20101223032804.000|TR0|when gay people get AIDS and die.  Do you 
20101223032804.000|20101223032806.000|TR0|want gay people to die?
20101223032806.000|20101223032809.000|TR0|
20101223032809.000|20101223032811.000|TR0|MCCANCE:  No, I don't.
20101223032811.000|20101223032813.000|TR0|
20101223032813.000|20101223032815.000|TR0|COOPER:  Some of the -- you know, clearly,
